definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: Soliciting a scarlet woman in China can be a serious crime.
sentences.chinese: 在中国大陆拉皮条，可能是重罪。

sentences.english: He became well known for pandering to any man who needed a woman.
sentences.chinese: 他以给人拉皮条而臭名昭著。

sentences.english: She just had an operation on the face to make herself look younger.
sentences.chinese: 她刚刚做了面部拉皮手术。
信仰拉皮德斯有我们的故事。

sentences.english: Mount Merapi last erupted in 2006, killing two people.
sentences.chinese: 默拉皮火山上次喷发是在2006年，造成2人死亡。

sentences.english: For many years David lived an evil life, pandering to men's sexual's desires.
sentences.chinese: 多年来大卫一直过着邪恶的生活，为男人拉皮条。

sentences.english: I plan to have a face-lift to tighten my face skin.
sentences.chinese: 我计划做个拉皮手术使我脸上的皮肤紧致一些。
我准备好要做拉皮手术了。

sentences.english: Faith Lapidus tells about the awards and one of the winners.
sentences.chinese: 信仰拉皮迪告诉有关的奖项和获奖者之一。

sentences.english: Cows killed in the eruption of Mount Merapi lie in Argomulyo, Indonesia.
sentences.chinese: 印尼默拉皮火山爆发，放到了阿果穆罗的奶牛。
高度为3000米的默拉皮火山是著名不可预知的。

sentences.english: How long can electric wave sheet-jelly operation effect keep?
sentences.chinese: 电波拉皮手术效果能保持多久？

sentences.english: She has just done a face-lift facial surgery.
sentences.chinese: 她刚刚做了面部拉皮手术。

sentences.english: And I am not pimping you out.
Faith Lapidus has our report from some wineries in Virginia.
sentences.chinese: 我们从信仰拉皮迪已在弗吉尼亚州一些酒厂的报告。

sentences.english: I heard that she got a face lift a couple of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我听说她在几年前动了拉皮手术。

definition: abbr. for 微整形[wei1 zheng3 xing2]
shaping/reshaping/plastic surgery or orthopedics (abbr. of 整形外科[zheng3 xing2 wai4 ke1])
non-surgical cosmetic procedure (injection of Botox, hyaluronic acid etc)
to win honor/to put on a stern face/to have a facial (beauty treatment)
to stir-fry with oil only (no addition of water)
to improve one's appearance (using cosmetics or cosmetic surgery)/to make oneself more attractive/to beautify
